revised_title: Radiation-Induced Cross-Linking and Degradation of Paraffin Chains
tldr: The authors studied the effects of high-energy radiation on paraffin chains, observing a decrease in melting points and eventual formation of insoluble gels. They found that the energy required to form cross-links is independent of chain length, and that for every cross-link formed, approximately 0.35 C-C bonds in the main chain are fractured. This research has implications for understanding polymerization processes under radiation exposure.
